Question
========

Suppose the height of Dutch women has a normal distribution with a mean µ = 65 inches and a standard deviation σ = 2.7 inches. Then what is the probability that if you choose a randomly selected woman in Netherlands, she will be 60 inches or shorter?

Answerlist
----------

* 0,032
* 0,500
* 0,923
* 0,968

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.032: Correct
* 0.500: Incorrect
* 0.923: Incorrect
* 0.968: Incorrect
